page.title: 09Housing
page.content: The houses in Seaton Delaval 30 years ago were mainly{colliery rows}with names such as Double Row, Foreman's Row and Middle Row. When the colliery closed in 1960 most of the population had been re-housed nearer to the Avenue Head. Today the houses are a mixture of modern dwellings and pre-war terraced housing. We did a survey of the{types {of houses}which the children in our school live in. Here are the results: Terraced house -33 Semi-detached -85 Detached -22 Bungalow - 3 Terraced flat - 3. In some places the shape of the streets has hardly changed from the turn of the century, in others what were fields are now attractive modern estates.
